Course Description: THIS COURSE IS DESIGNED TO PREPARE STUDENTS TO BE AUDITEES RATHER THAN AUDITORS.  IT WILL OFFER STUDENTS AN INTRODUCTION TO CONCEPTS AND ACCOUNTING TOOLS USED IN AUDITING.  STUDENTS WILL ALSO BE INTRODUCED TO THE OTHER ASSURANCE SERVICES THAT ACCOUNTANTS PERFORM.  SIGNIFICANT EMPHASIS WILL BE PLACED ON EDUCATING STUDENTS ABOUT SOUND INTERNAL CONTROL PROCEDURES AND ABOUT THEIR LEGAL AND ETHICAL OBLIGATIONS IN THE ACCOUNTING PROFESSION.
Objectives / Learning Outcome(s) / Major:
1.	RECOGNIZE CONCEPTS AND ACCOUNTING TOOLS USED IN A FINANCIAL STATEMENT AUDIT.
2.	DEFINE THE OTHER ASSURANCE SERVICES THAT ACCOUNTANTS PERFORM, AND EXPLAIN THE LEGAL RESPONSIBILITIES ATTACHED TO THOSE SERVICES.
3.	SUMMARIZE THE SARBANES-OXLEY ACT OF 2002.
4.	APPLY SOUND INTERNAL CONTROL PRACTICES.
5.	ANALYZE RECENT FRAUD CASES AND AUDIT FAILURES, USING A CASE STUDY APPROACH.
6.	RECOGNIZE THE ETHICAL AND LEGAL RESPONSIBILITIES OF ACCOUNTANTS.
Transfer Status: GUARANTEED TRANSFER TO INSTITUTION OFFERING SAME COURSE.
